Package slogo.compiler.command

Class SLogoCommand

java.lang.Object
slogo.compiler.token.SLogoToken
slogo.compiler.WorkspaceEntry
slogo.compiler.command.SLogoCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
SLogoRunnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AndCommand, ArcTangentCommand, BackwardCommand, ClearScreenCommand, CosineCommand, DifferenceCommand, DoTimesCommand, EqualCommand, EvaluateNumberCommand, ForCommand, ForwardCommand, GreaterThanCommand, HeadingCommand, HideTurtleCommand, HomeCommand, IfCommand, IfElseCommand, IsPenDownCommand, IsShowingCommand, LeftCommand, LessThanCommand, MakeUserInstructionCommand, MakeVariableCommand, MinusCommand, NaturalLogCommand, NotCommand, NotEqualCommand, OrCommand, PenDownCommand, PenUpCommand, PiCommand, PowerCommand, ProductCommand, QuotientCommand, RandomCommand, RemainderCommand, RepeatCommand, RightCommand, SetHeadingCommand, SetPositionCommand, SetTowardsCommand, ShowTurtleCommand, SineCommand, SLogoUserDefinedCommand, SumCommand, TangentCommand, XCoordinateCommand, YCoordinateCommand
public abstract class SLogoCommand
extends WorkspaceEntry
implements SLogoRunnable
An interface that provides methods to completely define an SLogo supported command. All commands must implement this interface, because the Compiler and Function rely on identifying Command objects in order to compile and run a user-entered String. Since commands have different functionalities, any object that implements Command needs access to the slogo.Turtle and the Workspace.

  • Constructor Details

    • SLogoCommand

      public SLogoCommand​(java.lang.String name)
      All SLogoToken objects have a name property. For subclasses of SLogoCommand, the default constructor takes in no parameters, and calls the superclass parameter with the name of the command.
      Parameters:
      name - - the name of the command

  • Method Details

    • attachTurtle

      public void attachTurtle​(Turtle attachedTurtle)
      Takes in the instance of the Turtle class that all SLogoCommand objects share.
      Parameters:
      attachedTurtle - - the common instance of the model

    • giveNextExpectedToken

      public boolean giveNextExpectedToken​(SLogoToken token)
      Takes in a SLogoToken object and attempts to add it to the list of parameters. If the given token is the correct type, this method places it in expectedParameters and returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.
      Specified by:
      giveNextExpectedToken in interface SLogoRunnable
      Parameters:
      token - - a Token expected by the Command as a parameter
      Returns:
      - true if the given parameter was successfully added, false otherwise

    • run

      public abstract SLogoToken run() throws SLogoException
      Performs the intended function of the Command, with the end result potentially affecting other classes such as slogo.Turtle or Workspace. This method should first check that isReady() is true, ensuring it has the correct number of parameters. Next, it should perform its function, using helper methods as needed. Running this method is an assurance that the syntax of all parameters is correct; however, this method still can throw an exception if it encounters an issue while running (i.e. an illegal turtle movement).
      Specified by:
      run in interface SLogoRunnable
      Returns:
      - a Constant token containing the return value of the command.
      Throws:
      SLogoException

    • getNumExpectedTokens

      public int getNumExpectedTokens()
      Any object that implements Command must store a List of Lists of Tokens that it expects as parameters in order to run properly. The length of the outer list indicates the number of expected parameters, while each inner list contains all possible types of Tokens that can be taken for that parameter.
      Returns:
      - List of parameters needed, specifying possible Token types for each parameter

    • isReady

      public boolean isReady()
      Identifies whether the command has sufficient parameters to run. Note, the run method does not call isReady, so it is the responsibility of the outside class to check that isReady is true before running a command.
      Specified by:
      isReady in interface SLogoRunnable
      Returns:
      - true if the command has all necessary parameters, false otherwise

    • resetCommand

      public void resetCommand()
      Does not clear the parameters given, but from the command's perspective this method requires it to receive all parameters over again. Needed for SLogoUserDefinedCommand, which has to create ready-to-run commands to test that the command can be defined. This method should be called after creating the commands the first time, such that they can be run with actual parameters when the user-defined command is called.
